topic.title: Configuring Hot Plug

body.p: Switchtec provides extensive customization and controls for supporting various hot-plug configurations. Each configuration mentioned in How it works - PCIe Hot-plug will be covered in this section.

section.title: How Switchtec PCIe Connector Settings Relate to P2P Configuration Space
section.p: The Switchtec configuration file is used to configure not only physical ports and GPIOs, but also configuration space entries in the P2P CSR. Defining PCIe connector sidebands will enable the corresponding capability in P2P configuration space. This is illustrated in Figure 1.

fig.title: PCIe connector settings and how they map to P2P CSR

section.p: In Table 1 all Switchtec configurable sidebands that are tied to P2P configuration space are provided.

table.title: PCIe Connector Sidebands and related P2P CSRs

entry.p: Slot Control - Presence Detect Change Enable
For SFF-8644/43 slot types this pin is used as Cable Presence. For U.2, this pin used to determine drive type. For SHPC and other types, this pin is synonymous with PRSNT#.

Switch uses this pin as presence for U.2 drives while the PRSNT# pin on the U.2 connector is used to determine drive type (see notes below). Both pins MUST be defined for U.2 connector type. If a PRSNT# pin is not wired from the connector to the switch, a vGPIO can be defined to set the correct value of "float/1" for NVMe drive type.
More information on handling of U.2 is provided in
Slot Control - Attention Button Pressed Enable
Only used in Managed hot plug. All other use cases are not formally supported.
Provides control for the host to disable and enable power to the port.
Slot Control - MRL Sensor Changed Enable
Optional. Used to indicate the state of a manual retention latch used to hold an EP in place.
Optional. Drives the attention indicator LED as per PCIe Base Specification 3.1
Optional. Drives the power indicator LED as per PCIe Base Specification 3.1
Optional. Used to control a mechanical interlock preventing users from removing an EP.
Slot Control - Power Fault Detected Enable
Must be used in conjunction with Power Controller. Reports a power fault condition (e.g. could be connected to regulator power good)

note.p: 1 For U.2 endpoints Endpoints, to allow Switchtec to detect that an EP is a NVMe or a SAS/SATA drive, BOTH Interface Detect and Device Presence Status Change GPIO Index need to be defined as below.
If no physical pin exists for Device Presence Status Change, a vGPIO can bet defined with the appropriate value to match the device type (for NVMe, Presence should be floating)

section.title: PCIe Connector and GPIO Settings to Support Hot-plug
section.p: Table 2 provides recommended settings for hot-plug related sidebands as defined in the PCIe connector and GPIO Adapter Settings blocks.

table.title: Downstream Port Connector and GPIO settings

note.p: Refer to PCIe Connector Settingsfor field descriptions

The default of a Slot Capability Bit setting is defined by the PCIe Connector Sideband GPIO Index assignment and the corresponding GPIOs Initialized State. For example if the entry for Power Controller GPIO index is "GPIO Adapter #1 - Pin #8" and the initialized state for "GPIO Adapter #1 - Pin #8" is equal to '1', then the Power Controller Preset Slot Capability Bit (bit 1) will be set to '1'. This is only applicable to outputs.
